title: Interpret confidence level for health care plans

content.prompt: Which of the following statements is a correct interpretation of the 95 percent confidence level?

choices.label: The probability is 0.95 that the percent of adults living in the United States who are satisfied with their health care plans is between 63.6% and 68.4%.

Approximately 95% of random samples of the same size from the population will result in a confidence interval that includes the proportion of all adults living in the United States who are satisfied with their health care plans.

Approximately 95% of random samples of the same size from the population will result in a confidence interval that includes the proportion of all adults in the sample who are satisfied with their health care plans.
Approximately 95% of all random samples of adults living in the United States will indicate that between 63.6% and 68.4% of the adults are satisfied with their health care plans.

Approximately 95% of all random samples of adults living in the United States will result in a sample proportion of 0.66 adults living in the United States who are satisfied with their health care plans.

topic.text: 6.3: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
